content:
• Wednesday, February 14, 2018
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold -6% after Q4 miss; guides 2018 production lower

    • Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) -5.8% after-hours as it misses Q4 earnings expectations with a 10% Y/Y decline in revenues.
    • KGC says Q4 production totaled 652.7K gold equiv. oz., -12.5% Y/Y, at all-in sustaining cost of $1,019/oz,, nearly unchanged compared to the year-ago quarter; for FY 2017, production was 2.67M gold equiv. oz., -4% Y/Y, with AISC of $954/oz. vs. $984/oz. for FY 2016.
    • For 2018, KGC expects to produce ~2.5M gold equiv. oz. at all-in sustaining cost of $975/oz., with total capex forecast at $1.075B.
    • Separately, KGC agrees to acquire two hydroelectric power plants in Brazil from Gerdau (NYSE:GGB) for $257M to secure a long-term supply of power for its Paracatu mine.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 PM | 6 Comments
  • FOX

    Netflix poaches top Fox TV creator Murphy in five-year megadeal

    • Seemingly concerned about what's next for media assets at Fox (FOX, FOXA) that are headed into the umbrella of Disney (NYSE:DIS), Ryan Murphy -- TV's most prolific producer -- has signed a deal said to be worth a hefty $250M-$300M over five years with Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX).
    • Murphy has been responsible for such Fox/FX hits as Nip/Tuck, Glee, American Horror Story and American Crime Story over the past 15 years.
    • The total value of the deal depends on viewership targets.
    • The change is unquestionably a blow for Fox, which has four Murphy shows on FX right now (and American Horror Story is FX's top-rated series).
    • It's Netflix's second big deal with one of TV's biggest hitmakers: Last August, it poached Shonda Rhimes from ABC with a five-year deal for at least $100M.
    • Netflix shares gained 3% today, while Fox was mostly flat and Disney closed up 0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 PM | 28 Comments
  • EQIX

    Equinix -3.9% amid falling Q4 FFO, Infomart Dallas deal

    • Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) is 3.9% lower after hours after its Q4 report, marked by a drop in FFO and a major deal for a giant information hub.
    • Funds from operations fell to $285.6M from $286.1M; adjusted funds from operations dropped to $381.5M from $391.3M.
    • Adjusted EBITDA rose to $564.8M from $550.3M, but missed an expected $569.9M.
    • The company is buying Infomart Dallas -- one of the biggest interconnection hubs in the country -- in a deal valued at $800M from ASB Real Estate Investments. Equinix has four of its eight Dallas-area IBX centers at Infomart.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $1.204B-$1.212B (below consensus for $1.223B) and EBITDA of $549M-$557M (light of consensus for $578.8M). For the full year, it's forecasting adjusted funds from operations of $1.635B (14% gain Y/Y), revenues of more than $5.01B (consensus is for $5.08B), a 15% Y/Y gain, and EBITDA exceeding $2.385B (vs. consensus for $2.45B).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • CF

    CF Industries +2% following lighter than expected Q4 loss

    • CF Industries (NYSE:CF) +2.2% after-hours as it reports a smaller than expected Q4 loss and a 27% Y/Y increase in revenues to a higher than anticipated $1.1B, amid higher sales volumes across most segments and higher average selling prices across all segments.
    • CF says Q4 total sales volume of 5.3M tons was the highest quarterly sales volume in the company's history, beating the previous record by 5%; CF cites increased production increased at the Donaldsonville and Port Neal Nitrogen Complex.
    • Average selling prices for the quarter were higher Y/Y across all segments due largely to a tighter global nitrogen supply and demand balance; the company's average selling price for ammonia was $285/ton in Q4 vs. $277 in the year-earlier quarter, the average selling price for urea was $244/ton vs. $214 a year ago, and the average selling price for UAN was $150/ton vs. $149 a year ago.
    • CF expects H1 nitrogen prices to be supported above year-ago prices by the combination of a somewhat weaker U.S. dollar, higher energy costs in key producing regions, reduced production in China, higher oil and freight costs, and steady global demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • GG

    Goldcorp +3% as Q4 net profit more than doubles

    • Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) +3.2% after-hours as Q4 earnings more than double from a year ago and easily beats analyst expectations, and its program to implement $250M of sustainable annual efficiencies by mid-2018 is on track with nearly $200M achieved in 2017 across the company's portfolio.
    • GG says Q4 gold production of 646K oz. fell 15% Y/Y but full-year gold output of 2.57M oz. edged past the midpoint of company guidance of 2.5M oz.; Q4 all-in sustaining costs of $870/oz. exceeded AISC of $747/oz. for the year-ago quarter while full-year AISC of $824/oz. was in line with improved midpoint guidance of $825/oz., which the company says reflects progress in its sustainable efficiency program.
    • GG expects to produce 2.5M oz. of gold in 2018, in line with previous guidance, with AISC seen declining further to ~$800/oz.; over the longer term, the company forecasts gold production to rise 20% to 3M oz. by 2021 with AISC declining 20% to ~$700/oz.over the same period.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • CXW

    Corecivic in expansion mode, developing a new facility in Kansas

    • Corecivic (NYSE:CXW) reported Q4 FFO of $0.60 per share, vs consensus of $0.55 per share. Revenues fell 5.1% Y/Y to $440.6M vs $429.8M consensus.
    • The company issued guidance for FY 2018 seeing FFO/share of $2.23 to 2.31.
    • CoreCivic entered into new contracts with three different states and in 2018, the REIT was awarded a contract to develop a new correctional facility in a public-private partnership that will be leased and operated by a government agency in Lansing, Kan.
    • Conference call at 11 a.m. ET.
    • Previously: Corecivic beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Feb. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 6 Comments
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil moves higher after Q4 earnings, revenues top forecasts

    • Marathon Oil (NYSE:MRO) +1.5% after-hours as it reports better than expected Q4 earnings and a 23% Y/Y revenue increase to $1.38B, also more than anticipated.
    • MRO plans a 2018 capital budget of $2.3B, up slightly vs. $2.2B in 2017, with ~60% to be spent in the Bakken shale and Eagle Ford shale and the remainder in the Permian Basin and in Oklahoma; the company says the budget should maintain breakeven at $50/bbl oil.
    • Q4 production rose 4% Q/Q to 383K boe/day, with U.S. resource play production climbing 10% Q/Q to average 249K net boe/day.
    • MRO forecasts total 2018 production available for sale will average 390K-410K net boe/day, up 12% Y/Y at the midpoint; annual oil output available for sale is seen increasing 18% at the midpoint, driven by 20%-25% oil growth in the U.S. resource plays.
    • MRO expects Q1 U.S. production will average 265K-275K net boe/day, while international output, excluding Libya, averages 105K-115K net boe/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 19 Comments
  • ARR

    Armour Residential tops Q4 estimates, reports big drop in book value for Q1; shares -1.5%

    • Q4 core income of $32.5M or $0.68 per share vs. $32.6M and $0.69 earned in Q3. Dividend run rate is $0.57 per quarter.
    • Dec. 31 book value per share of $26.62 was down $0.06 from three months earlier.
    • Economic return on book value for the quarter was 1.9%.
    • Updating for goings-on thus far in Q1, the company says book value has dropped to $24.72 as of Feb. 13. The current price of $22.41 is a 9.3% discount to book.
    • The conference call is just underway.
    • Previously: ARMOUR Residential REIT beats by $0.02 (Feb. 14)
    • ARR -1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 7 Comments
  • XEC

    Cimarex Energy -3% as 2018 capex projected rising 29% to ~$1.65B

    • Cimarex Energy (NYSE:XEC) -3.1% after-hours despite reporting better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues, as the company projects 2018 capex of $1.6B-$1.7B, a 29% increase from 2017 levels at the midpoint.
    • Q4 production averaged 1.2B cfe/day, with oil production rising 36% Y/Y; proved reserves increased 16% to 3.4T cfe while replacing 211% of 2017 production.
    • XEC expects Q1 production will average 198K-207K boe/day, with oil production increasing ~3% Q/Q while natural gas and natural gas liquids come in flat.
    • For FY 2018, XEC forecasts production of 211K-221K boe/day, up 14% at the midpoint from 2017 levels, with oil production rising 21%-26%. Fourth quarter 2018 oil production is projected to increase 29-34 percent over fourth quarter 2017 levels
    • XEC says it plans to invest $1.3B-$1.4B on the drilling and completion of 127 net wells during 2018, with nearly 70% of capital spent in the Permian region and the remainder in the Mid-Continent.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • TRIP

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/14/2018)

    • Top gainers: TRIP +16.8%. SEDG +14.5%. CTL +9.6%. TEVA +8.0%. CSCO +6.0%.
    • Top losers: NTAP -8.6%. SPWR -7.5%. CTAS -5.0%. EQIX -3.9%. MAR -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • LPI

    Laredo Petroleum +4% after Q4 beat, $200M stock buyback program

    • Laredo Petroleum (NYSE:LPI) +4.6% after-hours following a narrow Q4 earnings beat but also posting a 30% Y/Y revenue increase and announcing a $200M share repurchase program.
    • LPI reiterates its anticipated FY 2018 production growth guidance of at least 10% compared with 2017, and forecasts Q1 production averaging 62K boe/day.
    • "During 2017, Laredo's development plan yielded well-level returns on invested capital exceeding 30% while making meaningful progress towards co-developing multiple landing points in our Upper and Middle Wolfcamp formations," LPI says.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 9 Comments
  • CTL

    CenturyLink +11.2% after Level 3 boost to Q4 earnings

    • CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL) is up 11.2% on after-hours volume of nearly 1M shares following Q4 earnings where a strong quarter for revenues gave a lift to wrap up the year.
    • Revenues grew 24% Y/Y to $5.323B, lifting the company to a 1% gain for the full year, boosted by very healthy results in a business segment that's added Level 3 Communications.
    • Results include two months of Level 3 performance. On a pro forma basis (assuming Level 3 acquisition and selling data centers/co-location had wrapped Jan. 1, 2016), revenue was flat at $6B, and EBITDA was flat on an adjusted and unadjusted basis, while capex dropped to $829M from $1.25B.
    • Revenue by segment: Business, $3.73B (up 42%); Consumer, $1.4B (down 5.7%).
    • Cash, equivalents and marketable securities were $551M as of Dec. 31.
    • For 2018, it's guiding to EBITDA of $8.75B-$8.95B (vs. consensus for $8.86B), free cash flow (before dividends) of $3.15B-$3.35B, and dividends of $2.3B, as well as capex about 16% of revenue and a full-year effective income tax rate of about 25%.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 73 Comments
  • CDMO

    Avid Bio readies stock offering; shares down 15% after hours

    • Avid Bioservices (NASDAQ:CDMO) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced. Shares are down 15% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • A

    Agilent FQ1 top line up 14%; non-GAAP earnings up 26%; cash flow up 85%; guidance raised; shares up 2% after hours

    • Agilent (NYSE:A) fiscal Q1 results ($M): Revenues: 1,211 (+13.5%).
    • Net loss: (320) (-290.5%); non-GAAP net income: 216 (+25.6%); loss/share: (0.99) (-290.4%); non-GAAP EPS: 0.66 (+24.5%); cash flow ops: 215 (+85.3%).
    • GAAP results negatively impacted by a $533M charge related to U.S. tax reform.
    • Fiscal 2018 guidance: Revenue growth: midpoint of 5.50% from midpoint of 4.25%; non-GAAP EPS: midpoint of $2.65 from midpoint of $2.53; cash flow ops: $1.05B from $970M.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTAP

    NetApp slides despite delivering beats in Q3

    • NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) has tumbled 8.6% after hours on heavy volume despite fiscal Q3 earnings where it topped expectations with the help of double-digit gains in product sales.
    • Net income swung to a headline loss of $506M, but affected by tax reform legislation and the transition tax on foreign earnings. On a non-GAAP basis, net income rose to $273M from a year-ago $231M.
    • The company notes its $2B in all-flash array annunalized net revenue run rate was up nearly 50% Y/Y.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $920M (up 17.3%); Software maintenance, $237M (down 1.3%); Hardware maintenance and other services, $366M (down 3.7%).
    • Cash, equivalents and investments were $5.6B at quarter's end; cash from operations was $420M vs. a year-ago $235M.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to net revenues of $1.525B-$1.675B (vs. consensus for $1.568B), and EPS of $0.95-$1.03 (vs. consensus for $1.00).
    • Conference call to come at 5:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • CF Industries (NYSE:CF): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $1.1B (+26.9% Y/Y) beats by $122.09M.
    • Shares +2.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 7 Comments
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor soars after earnings

    • TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) flew past revenue and EBITDA estimates with its Q4 report.
    • The company also kicked up EBITDA of $63M during the quarter vs. $51M consensus. EBITDA margin rose two percentage points to 20.0% compared to a year ago.
    • TripAdvisor says its click-based auction results generally stabilized during the quarter and online acquisition costs fell back.
    • TripAdvisor says it plans to buy up to $250M worth of its shares.
    • 2018 TripAdvior outlook: "We expect 2018 consolidated revenue and adjusted EBITDA year-over-year performance will be second half-weighted, driven by brand marketing investments in the first half of the year that were not in the year-ago period, as well as by tough year-over-year comparisons in our click-based and transaction business."
    • Previously: TripAdvisor misses by $0.08, beats on revenue (Feb. 14)
    • TRIP +18% AH to $48.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 5 Comments
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials +3% after record sales drive beats, doubled dividend

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) is up 3% in heavy after-hours volume following a fiscal Q1 earnings report that featured outsized current-quarter guidance to go with a beat on top and bottom lines.
    • Revenue hit a quarterly record with broad gains across key product lines. Non-GAAP EPS grew 58% and hit a record of $1.06.
    • It's taking a $1B tax charge, including an estimate of a transition tax payable over eight years.
    • The company's also doubling its dividend to $0.20, and boosting share repurchase authorization by $6B -- incremental to $2.8B remaining under a previous authorization.
    • Net sales by segment: Semiconductor Systems, $2.85B (up 32.4%); Applied Global Services, $880M (up 30.2%); Display and Adjacent Markets, $455M (up 7.8%)
    • Cash flow from operations rose 85% to $1.47B.
    • For Q2, it's guiding to net sales of $4.35B-$4.55B (growth of 26% at the midpoint, and well above consensus for $4.22B) and EPS of $1.10-$1.18 (up 44% at the midpoint and well over consensus for $1.01).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 27 Comments
  • SEDG

    SolarEdge +14% after easy Q4 beat; guides Q1 revenues above consensus

    • SolarEdge Technologies (NASDAQ:SEDG) +13.8% after-hours following an easy Q4 earnings beat and a 70% Y/Y revenue increase to a company record $189M.
    • SEDG also issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing revenues of $200M-$210M vs. $157M analyst consensus estimate; gross margins are forecast to come in at 36%-38%.
    • SEDG says Q4 GAAP gross margin reached 37.5%, up from 34.9% in Q3 and up from 35% Y/Y; cash flow from operating activities was $45.8M, up from $33.6M in Q3 and $24.7M in the year-ago quarter.
    • "We grew our revenues in each of the geographies in which we operate and overcame a challenging year in terms of industry-wide component availability and growing our manufacturing capacity to support the growing demand for our products," SEDG says.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • TEVA

    Teva up 7% after hours on Berkshire stake

    • CNBC reports that Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has established a $358M stake in Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NYSE:TEVA). Shares are up 7% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 139 Comments
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor EPS of $0.06, beats on revenue

    • TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q4 Adj. EPS of $0.06 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.14.
    • Revenue of $321M (+1.6% Y/Y) beats by $8.83M.
    • Shares +15%.

  • CC

    Chemours beats by $0.22, beats on revenue

    • Chemours (NYSE:CC): Q3 EPS of $1.19 beats by $0.22.
    • Revenue of $1.58B (+19.7% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +1.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • CSCO

    Cisco +5.7% after Q2 beats, upside Q3 guidance

    • Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) is up 5.7% after hours in early going after fiscal Q2 earnings beat on top and bottom lines and guidance for current-quarter profits runs ahead of consensus.
    • The company posted a net loss of $8.8B vs. a year-ago gain of $2.3B, though those results included an $11.1B charge tied to tax reform ($9B for U.S. transition tax, $1.2B for foreign withholding and $0.9B to remeasure deferred tax assets).
    • On a non-GAAP basis, net income rose to $3.1B from $2.9B, and EPS went up 11% to $0.63.
    • It also boosted its quarterly dividend by $0.04 (14%) to $0.33/share, and increased its stock repurchase authorization by $25B with no fixed termination date (that brings total authorized amount to $31B).
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $8.71B (up 2.6%); Servie, $3.18B (up 2.9%).
    • For Q3, it's guiding to 3-5% revenue growth, gross margin of 63-64%, operating margin of 29.5-30.5%, and EPS of $0.64-$0.66 (above consensus for $0.63).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 25 Comments
  • ATHN

    Athenahealth sees revenues as high as $1.38B this year

    • At its Investor Summit, athenahealth (ATHN +5.6%) provided guidance for 2018:
    • Revenues: $1.31B - 1.38B; operating income: $108M - 152M; non-GAAP operating income: $210M - 235M.
    • Key focus areas:
    • Drive top-line growth in core services and build on network services.
    • Balance service automation with investments in client work reduction efforts.
    • Invest in R&D to support product, technology and platform strategies.
    • Improve efficiency and increase scale across the business.
    • Increase operating margin and cash flow ops.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM

    Agilent beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Agilent (NYSE:A): Q1 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $1.21B (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $50M.
    • Shares +2.4%.
    • Press Release

    Cisco beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO): Q2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $11.88B (+2.6% Y/Y) beats by $70M.
    • Shares +3%.

  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics readies stock offering

    • Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • NOC

    Northrop Grumman upgraded at Jefferies on Orbital ATK deal benefits

    • Northrop Grumman (NOC +2%) is higher after Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $400 price target, hiked from $345, with the case for owning the stock strengthened by yesterday's approval of the acquisition of Orbital ATK by European regulators.
    • If the addition of Orbital ATK generates $200M, or 5%, in cost synergies and accelerated revenue growth, the deal could add as much as $2.30/share in 2020, Jefferies says.
    • The firm also thinks the deal gives NOC a competitive position on the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent program, an $85B initiative to modernize intercontinental ballistic missiles that could be worth $15/share alone.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 12 Comments
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy upgraded at BMO as 20% recent dropoff unjustified

    • Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +3.1%) is higher after BMO Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform with a $26 price target, noting the stock's ~20% fall since PTEN's Q4 earnings release.
    • BMO believes PTEN's fundamentals are improving, and management's commentary of adding up to 200 rigs at year-end compared to 2017 implies the potential for upside to consensus estimates in H2 2018.
    • While the absence of a dividend increase was disappointing, BMO says the ensuing selloff was unwarranted, and the firm estimates PTEN's free cash flow yield for 2018 at 3.7%, which would rank it as one of the highest within the land-drilling space and possibly causing a 50% dividend increase in the future.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop continues post-earnings run, +8.4% amid upgrades

    • Vipshop Holdings (NYSE:VIPS) is up another 8.4%, continuing a run from Monday's earnings report, as analysts boost ratings.
    • Shares are up 23.5% over the three days.
    • HSBC has upgraded the ADRs to Buy from Hold, and raised its price target to $20 from $12, implying 14% upside from the last close.
    • Meanwhile, Macquarie has upgraded Vipshop to Outperform as well. And China Renaissance has boosted its rating to Buy from Hold, with a price target of $21 (17% upside from last close).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 6 Comments
  • TECK

    Teck predicts strong demand for steelmaking coal this year

    • Teck Resources (TECK +2.3%) says it expects growing global steel production to boost demand for its steelmaking coal in 2018, and believes the company is well positioned to benefit from continued strength in commodity prices.
    • Teck is “feeling pretty good about 2018” after reporting in-line financial results, CEO Don Lindsay said during today's earnings conference call, and steelmaking coal demand is expected to keep climbing in 2018 while ongoing logistics and production issues at key Australian mines support prices.
    • Teck forecasts steelmaking coal production of 26M-27M metric tons in 2018 and 26.5M-27.5M metric tons in 2019-22 despite this year’s closure of its Coal Mountain operations.
    • Shares of Teck, up nearly 15% YTD, are more than 2% higher after rebounding from steep early losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 13 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen slides 6% after Alzheimer study news

    • via @zbiotech
    • Presenting at the Leerink Partners conference, management says it's sizing up by about 510 patients its aducanumab trials due to "increased variability."
    • Webcast here
    • BIIB -6.2%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 51 Comments

    Hickok reports Q1 results

    • Hickok (OTCQB:HICKA): Q1 EPS of $0.16
    • Revenue of $11.75M (+397.9% Y/Y)
    • Shares +5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • CRTO

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/14/18)

    • Gainers: CRTO +28%. CCIH +26%. FNJN +21%. CARB +19%. TWLO +18%.
    • Losers: LXFT -14%. GRPN -12%. INPX -9%. HMNY -8%. ECOM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • BG

    Bunge says has 'interested parties' for sugar trading business

    • Bunge (BG -6.2%) now sinks more than 6% following disappointing Q4 results and its worst annual profit reading since 2009.
    • BG says it is getting out of sugar trading and distribution and has identified a few interested parties for the business, but Citigroup's David Driscoll says sugar trading has been "historically positive” for the company - “I‘m not exactly clear why you’d really want to shut that one down,” the analyst said during today's earnings conference call.
    • CEO Soren Schroder said BG has struggled to generate enough gross margin to cover costs in sugar, and “we simply decided that it was time to really focus on what’s core to us, which is agribusiness, foods, grains and oilseeds and get on with it in a good way."
    • BG's Brazilian sugar milling business - which the company has been seeking to exit since 2013, as a supply glut has pushed prices lower and made it tough to turn a profit - will “have its own direction” from the trading business, Schroder said.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • TWLO

    Twilio +19% as Q4 revenues, guidance beat expectations

    • Twilio (TWLO +18.7%) skyrockets nearly 20%, reaching its best intraday level in more than three months, after the cloud communications company reported a narrower than expected Q4 loss and a 41% Y/Y revenue increase.
    • Excluding the impact from lower Uber orders - which now account for 5% of TWLO's quarterly sales - TWLO's Q4 base revenue rose 62% Y/Y.
    • TWLO forecasts Q4 revenues of $115M-$117M vs. $108M analyst consensus estimate, and revenues of $506M-$514M vs. $481M consensus for the full year.
    • TWLO also produced $3.2M of free cash flow in Q4 vs. a $6M cash burn in the year-ago period; it was the company's first positive free cash flow result since Q1 2016.
    • Canaccord reiterates its Buy rating and $38 price target, citing three takeaways: growth among bread-and-butter customers remains robust, the forecast leaves room for upside” this year, and the installation of several new key executives means TWLO is “ready for the next leg of its go-to-market evolution,” which could in turn bring more enterprise adoption of its product.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 2 Comments

  • Stocks ignore rising rates, shoot higher

    • This morning's speedy CPI report has helped send the 10-year Treasury yield to another cycle high, up 7.3 basis points to 2.902%.
    • Stocks have gone back to ignoring higher interest rates though, with the Nasdaq up 1.6%, the S&P 500 1.15%, and the Dow 0.8%.
    • Gold and oil are on the move as well, each up about 2%.
    • Bitcion too is joining the action, up 7.8% to $9.2K.

  • IPG

    Interpublic Group +11% as healthy Q4 looks to mark turnaround

    • Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) is up 10.7% on NYSE and inching closer to a 52-week high after posting Q4 earnings that beat on top and bottom lines and portended a reversal from a slow year.
    • Revenue rose 3.5% and organic revenue was up 3.3% (up 3.7% in U.S., up 2.9% internationally).
    • Operating income was $518.3M, up from $485.7M the prior year; operating margin rose to 22.1% from 21.4%.

    • Cash, equivalents and marketable securities came to $791M at Dec. 31, vs. the prior year's $1.1B. Total debt was $1.37B vs. the prior year's $1.69B.
    • The company also authorized a new buyback program for $300M in company stock; it has no expiration date. And it declared a quarterly common stock dividend of $0.21 vs. last year's $0.18.
    • "Looking ahead to 2018, we are targeting organic revenue growth in the range of 2% to 3% and operating margin expansion of 20 basis points over the results we are reporting today, which will build on our strong long-term record of improving profitability," says Chairman/CEO Michael Roth.
